origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Duke University. Program to Strengthen Medical Science Education.

did.unittitle: Program to Strengthen Medical Science Education records 1976-1980
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: The PSMSE began in the fall of 1976 as a means to foster the transition from a liberal, pre-professional education to a graduate professional education for Duke undergraduates interested in a career in medicine. The collection includes correspondence, minutes, memoranda, reports, grant proposals, and other records. The material ranges in date from 1976-1980.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
In off-site storage; 48 hours advance notice required for use.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: Copyright for Official University records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Program to Strengthen Medical Science Education Records, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Program to Strengthen Medical Science Education Records were received by the University Archives as a transfer in 1981, 1983.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection is minimally processed: materials may not have been ordered and described beyond their original condition.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Program to Strengthen Medical Science Education began in the fall of 1976 as a means to foster the transition from a liberal, pre-professional education to a graduate-professional education for Duke undergraduates interested in a career in medicine. The program required the formation of a close working relationship between Arts and Sciences and Medical faculty. It was supported by the Commonwealth Fund for four years; a proposal for a fifth year of support was turned down, ending the Program.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The collection includes correspondence, minutes, memoranda, reports, grant proposals, and other records. The material ranges in date from 1976-1980.

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.corpname: Duke University. Program to Strengthen Medical Science Education

did.unittitle: Advisory Committee correspondence, program proposal, Commonwealth Fund Grant origins/budget/correspondence
Program planning documents and correspondence, final drafts of Commonwealth Fund Grant proposal
Program proposal drafts, bound final version of proposal, CWF budgetary reports
